content.question: In the United States, the generation of people born between 1946 and 1964 are known as baby boomers, and the generation of people born between 1981 and 1996 are known as millennials. Currently, 18 percent of the population are baby boomers and 27 percent of the population are millennials. A random sample of 500 people will be selected. Let the random variable <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of baby boomers in the sample, and let the random variable <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of millennials in the sample. By how much will the mean of <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> exceed the mean of <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
